pButton.Name: FIEF
pButton.popInfo: An office (or title) and an estate (or manor) granted by liege to vassal.

pButton.Name: INVESTITURE
pButton.popInfo: The ceremonial act of conferring (or giving) a fief to a vassal.

pButton.Name: HOMAGE
pButton.popInfo: The vassal pledges loyalty (including military service when requested) to the liege lord.

pButton.Name: FEALTY
pButton.popInfo: The vassal swears a religious oath and is thereby bound to the liege lord. This newer Christian component of feudalism does not date back to the time of Germanic migrations.

pButton.Name: KNIGHTS IN SERVICE
pButton.popInfo: Knighthood was the ceremonial reception of a heroic squire into the military caste (or nobility) as a member of the armed cavalry.
